answers.answer: how on earth do you get to write out your problem ?

Hi,Have you consulted a physician for your condition? Was it a physician who gave you a diagnosis of a fungal infection?This may be a case of candidal balanitis.Balanitis may be due to a bacterial or fungal infection and usually involves the head of the penis.In your case a bacterial infection such as folliculitis may also be considered as a differential as you have mentioned that your pubic area is also involved.Do you have a strong family history of diabetes?Avoid any possible irritants such as strong soaps and tight underpants. Use clothing of cool and light materials only. Also refrain from any sexual activity for the moment until your condition is properly assessed. Avoid unnecessarily manipulating the area and also avoid sharing towels and other personal items.Discuss your medications with your physician. You may need to change or modify this.
yes i have went to a doctor . she swiped it and tested it ...   she told me it was a fungus???   what medications or creams should i try???   thank you

question: i ve had a FUNGUS on my penis and pubic region for about 2 years .  after about 6 months or so maybe more, the little white heads (fungus) on my pubic region went away ..  as it was going away they started to pop like pimples .  i still have the ones on the head of my penis and lately they seem to be getting worse .  they aslo get worse when i have sex or matserbate.  possibly because of the friction  they get erated .  the ones on my pubic region i pulled of with tweezers (they were like little white heads). and when i pulled then out they looked like the seed of a pimple . ive also tried triamcinolone acetonide . but that only makes them get smaller and harder to see .  it doesnt get rid of them.. please help thank youThis discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/239836.
